intro: Linanthus californicus, commonly known as the California linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Linanthus californicus is adapted to thrive in arid environments, showcasing features that enhance its survival in such conditions.
